Miriam is 31 years old and she is a woman who fights for her family's wellbeing. She lives with Angel, her husband of 7 years. They have a daughter, María Fernanda, whom they care for in their rented house locate din the city of La Oroya.
 
Her husband works as a teacher in a local school. On her part, Miriam opened a store where she offer a copying service, spiral binding and word processing. It is going very well for her in her business, because she has always done this type of work. in the five years since she started her work she has learned everything she needs to make her working capital grow. Thanks to that, she bought another photocopier that her younger sister manages in another city. But every weekend,  she visits to supervise her business. 

Additionally, she raises chickens, guinea pigs, bulls and chickens, which she sells at a higher price to the area butchers. .

She belongs to the “Cantuta” group and this is loan number 11 with MFP. She feels happy there because she receives the support that allows her to continue in her business. She promises to make her payments on time, since her association is made up of responsible and supportive people. 

Miriam will invest the money she has asked for in buying ink for her photocopier as well as reams of paper.

loans.use: Compra de tinta para su fotocopiadora y papel

loans.name: Kondokpogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KONDOKPOGBE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sègbégnon Blanche est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sègbégnon  Blanche est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Sègbégnon Blanche est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Paul. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge et tous scolarisés. Sègbégnon Blanche vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Sègbégnon Blanche vend depuis vingt ans des habits pour enfants et de façon secondaire des chaussures et du charbon de bois dans sa boutique. Sègbégnon  Blanche s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sègbégnon  Blanche sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KONDOKPOGBE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois prêts reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Kondokpogbe group is composed of three  friends living in the same neighborhood. This is the fourth time that the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé, in order to expand its business activities. The group’s representative, by the name of Sègbégnon Blanche, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Sègbégnon Blanche is 35 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to Paul, a mechanic. They have two dependent children, both in school. Sègbégnon Blanche lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide fro various household needs. In order to contribute to the family budge, for 20 years Sègbégnon Blanche has been selling children’s clothing and, in addition, shoes and charcoal, out of her store. She stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her revenues, Sègbégnon Blanche, together with the other members of the Kondokpogbe group, is seeking a fourth  loan from ALIDé. The three prior loans have been duly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and shoes [for resale].

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos  y vive en el municipio de Intibucá,  La Esperanza.
Don Miguel  toda su vida se ha dedicado a  la agricultura, pero hace 7 años esta  cultivando algunas parcelas de papa. La producción que saca la distribuye en el mercado local. El inicio con la ayuda de algunos préstamos que ODEF le ha proporcionado motivado a seguir trabajando obteniendo buena cosechas y aumentar su productividad.
El lleva 6 préstamos con Odef, y actualmente solicita otro de 28,000 lempiras para comprar semilla de papa, fertilizante e Insumos para fumigación,  dándole un buen mantenimiento podrá sacar una buena cosecha. Manifiesta que todo este esfuerzo y dedicación es para obtener mejores ingresos que cubran gastos  del hogar.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para obtener una  casa mejor con todas las comodidades que ofrecerle a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 56 years old, married, and has five children. He lives in the town of Intibucá, La Esperanza.

Don Miguel has engaged in agriculture his entire life, but the last seven years have been focused on cultivating potatoes on a few parcels of land. Whatever he produces is distributed at the local market. He started out with the help of a few loans that ODEF provided, which motivated him to continue working so that he could obtain a good harvest and increase his productivity.

Miguel has received six loans from ODEF. He is currently requesting another one in the amount of 28,000 HNL so that he can buy potato seedlings, fertilizers, and supplies for fumigation. This will enable him to maintain his crops well so that he can achieve a good harvest. He says that all of his efforts and dedication are geared toward generating more income to cover household expenses. His goal is to continue working so that he can obtain a better house with all the comforts that he can offer to his family.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizers, and farming supplies.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is married with four children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. Leonida is a farmer and grows corn and palay crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8000 to purchase farm inputs. 

Leonida has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Leonida hopes to harvest more corn and palay.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is living in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 53 years of age with two children. She owns and operates a retail store that has existed for more than 19 years now, quite a long time. She sells daily-use commodities and is a customer-oriented person. Every month, she earns 9,000 PHP. Lydia joined GDMPC in 2006. She has taken out several loans from the organization. With her loan of 14,000 PHP, she intends to purchase new items such as candies, milo (brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps etc. She hopes to expand her business inventory range and repair the store's look to increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 54 years old and married with three children.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Lorna has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lorna aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en: Gerry is 28 years old and single. He is from Baga, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where his rice production is located. He was just 22 years old when he started cultivating this land. That was a long time ago but he never ceases because his passion for being in this business urges him to go on working. At the end of the month, Gerry gets 8,000 PHP which he divides equally among his family. Gerry joined GDMPC to access financial services offered by the cooperative. He has borrowed 10,000 PHP to pay the land preparation cost to begin the next cycle of business operations. He hopes to plant sooner so as not to waste time. Gerry plans to apply appropriate fertilizers and expand his business.

loans.use: to pay the land preparation cost to begin the next cycle of business operations

loans.name: Armando Jr.

texts.en: Armando lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single and 28 years of age. He has earned his living by providing transportation services for five years. Armando earns a monthly income of 7,000 PHP through this business. Without hesitation, he is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business. He joined GDMPC in 2011. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Chanta Devi

texts.en: Chanta Devi is 40 years old.  She is married and has 2 children aged 19 and 16.  In 2001, she established her furniture making business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buys wood and timber.  In the future, Chanta Devi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buys wood and timber

loans.name: Segundo Raul

texts.es:
Segundo se describe como una persona responsable, trabajador y sociable. Segundo tiene 40 años vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos cerca de la ciudad de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Segundo trabaja con algunos socios en el sembrío de tomate, fréjol y cebolla en distintos terrenos, al momento segundo está acabando de cocechar el sembrío anterior y necesita empezar a sembrar nuevamente para seguir con la producción de su negocio, es por eso que realiza un nuevo préstamo en Fodemi el mismo que será invertido en la compra de fungicidas, abonos, semillas de fréjol, tomate, cebolla para un nuevo sembrío, el cual ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos y su producción, que mejorarán la calidad de vida de sus hijos y apoyará en los estudios de sus hijos.

Segundo sueña en construir una casita para su familia y comprar unos terrenos para que sus ingresos sean para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo describes himself as a responsible, hardworking, and sociable person. Segundo is forty years old and lives with his wife and three children near the city of Ibarra in the Imbabura province.

Segundo works with some colleagues planting tomato, beans, and onion in various plots of land, At the moment, Segundo is just harvesting the earlier planting and needs to start the new planting in order to continue with the production of his business. It is for this reason that he is pursuing a new loan with Fodemi. This will be used to purchase fungicides, fertilizers, and bean, tomato, and onion seeds for a new planting, which will help to increase his income and production. This in turn will improve his children's quality of life and will support their studies. 

Segundo dreams of constructing a little house for his family and buying some plots of land so that the earnings from them may be for him and his family.

loans.use:
Para la compra de fungicidas, abonos, semillas de fréjol, tomate, cebolla para un nuevo sembrío.
to buy fungicides, fertilizers, bean, tomato, and onion seeds for a new sowing

loans.name: Nanda Kumari

texts.en:
Nanda Kumari is 40 years old. She is married and has three children aged 20, 15 and 13. In 2000, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week, four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Nanda Kumari plans to lift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70 percent of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal) and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With Kiva loans, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
Nerlita is 61 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Nerlita runs a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Nerlita has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Nerlita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Iluminida

texts.en: Iluminida is married with 8 children. She is 58 years old and lives in Dinas, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Iluminida owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting coconut to earn a living. She has been in this business for 7 years and earns 7,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Iluminida has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Iluminida's plan is to save her profits in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 53 years old and is married with 6 children. She works very hard to provide for them. One of her children is in school. 

Lucia runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She's requested a loan of PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 50 years old and is married with 7 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from rice retail.

Ermelinda is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to puchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves tiene 46 años, vive en compañía de dos de sus cuatro hijos; Jarol y Julissa. La casa donde habita es propia y se ubica en el distrito de Chilca.  
Su sonrisa es muestra de su vitalidad. Ella se dedica a la siembra de papa, olluco, maca y habas; las que siembra una vez al año, pero como desea tener productos de calidad, constantemente los cuida, abona y protege. Agradece a la agricultura, pues le permitió mantener a sus hijos, brindándoles los alimentos del día. Las ganancias que percibe no son estables, por ello decidió incursionar en la costura, sin dejar de lado la agricultura. Es así que confecciona prendas de vestir de todo tamaño y calidad, cuenta que gana a la semana un promedio de 150 nuevos soles, pero en navidad, año nuevo y festividad agrícola es donde obtiene mejores ganancias. Por ello ahora desea mejorar su calidad de vida, con el arreglo de su casa. Pues sus hijos son todos profesionales y necesitan su espacio, afirma.	

Éste es su cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Nieves invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de maca y habas para sembrar. También adquirirá telas de diversos colores para realizar sus prendas.
texts.en:
Nieves is 46 years old. She lives with two of her four children, Jarol and Julissa. The house where they live is her own, and it is located in the Chilca district. Her smile is an example of her energy. She works sowing potatoes, olluco and maca [both root vegetables], and fava beans. She plants them once a year, but since she wants to have quality products, she constantly cares for them, fertilizes them, and protects them. She is grateful to agriculture, which has allowed her to care for her children, providing them with their daily diet. 

The earnings that she receives are not stable, so she decided to get into sewing, without giving up agriculture. She creates garments of all sizes and quality, and says she earns an average of 150 nuevos soles (PEN) a week, but she makes the best money at Christmas and the New Year, and during the agriculture festivities. So now she wishes to improve her quality of life by repairing her house; her children are all professionals, and they need their space, she states.

This is her fourth loan with MFP, with which she hopes to make her plans a reality. She promises to make her loan payments. In addition, she is pleased to be part of the association, because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Nieves will invest the requested money in the purchase of maca and fava bean seeds to sow. She will also purchase different colored fabrics to make her garments.

loans.use: to purchase seeds.

loans.name: Fanny Maribel

texts.es:
Fanny es una mujer de 27 años, madre de dos hijos con quienes vive en "Santo Domingo" que es cantón y ciudad de la nueva Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, que era parroquia rural de Quito la capital del Ecuador,  Santo Domingo está entre la costa y la sierra del Ecuador, punto de enlace entre Quito, Guayaquil, Portoviejo,  y otras ciudades importantes del país. Situado en los flancos externos de la cordillera occidental, así como en la planicie costeña inferior a los 1000 msnm, es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país. Tiene una gran riqueza hidrológica: existen cinco cuencas y micro cuencas importantes. Es una zona climática lluviosa subtropical, posee una temperatura promedio de 22 °C.

Fanny hace 3 años empezó a vender cosméticos puerta a puerta con lo que da sustento a su hogar; este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga y actualmente trabaja alrededor de 6 a 8 horas. Ahora ella quiere realizar una inversión la cual permita tener mayor variedad de productos a ofrecer y con ello podrá incrementar sus ventas y por ende aumentar sus ingresos. Fanny quiere dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Su gran sueño es tener una casa propia, donde ella y sus hijos puedan vivir más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Fanny is twenty-seven years old and the mother of two children with whom she lives in Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo is both a city and canton of the new province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which used to be a rural parish of Quito, the capital of Ecuador. It is between Ecuador's coast and mountain range, and serves as a link between Quito, Guayaquil, Portoviejo, and other important cities in the country. Situated on the outer side of the western range at 1000 meters above sea level, Santo Domingo, like the lower coastal plains, is the area of greatest rainfall in the country. It has great hydrological wealth: there are five important basins and micro-basins. It is a rainy, subtropical climatic zone and has an average temperature of twenty-two degrees Celsius.

Three years ago, Fanny began to sell cosmetics door to door in order to maintain her home. She learned the business from a friend and currently works between six and eight hours. Now she wants to make an investment which will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and with which she will be able to increase her sales and consequently her income. Fanny wants to give her family a better quality of life.

Her great dream is to have her own house, in which she and her children can live more comfortably.

loans.use:
para comprar mercadería para venderla
to buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Januka

texts.en: Januka is 39 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 19.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Januka plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase larger amounts of seeds and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
Sanu is 30 years old. She is married and has no children. 

In 2006, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy small chickens.  

In the future, Sanu plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buys small chickens.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco.  

La socia Bertha sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida en su pequeño restaurante, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien gracias a la puntualidad de sus pagos.    

La socia Bertha en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más.    

La socia Bertha está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Bertha continues to belong to the communal bank, "Mujeres Unidas," and lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco.

Bertha continues to make a living through the sale of food in her small restaurant. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who carries her family forward. Things went very well with her earlier credit, thanks to her punctuality in making her payments.
  
At this time, Bertha needs the loan in order to buy ingredients such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and various other things.

Bertha is happy for the loan and she promises to make her payments promptly.

loans.use: to buy food supplies such as, for example, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and various other things

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes works hard to support her family. She is married and makes crafts out of shells in the Philippines.

Ediltrudes requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials for her shells craft business.

Ediltrudes has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shells craft business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 62 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y allí tiene un restaurante donde se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y comidas caseras. Ella es una mujer separada que tiene 3 hijos   y desde muy joven  ha estado vinculada a la actividad comercial. . Antes de contraer matrimonio, trabajó en un municipio fronterizo de Colombia, durante 22 años en un almacén de donde adquirió su mayor experiencia como comerciante. Con su actual negocio ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante brindándole estudios, adquirió 2 viviendas  y   allí respondió a sus mas grandes desafíos hasta que se trasladó a la ciudad de Barraquilla y allí tuvo varios negocios, venta de arepas rellenas  en un sitio de gran movimiento peatonal, el cual desarrollaba en las horas de la noche y muy a la intemperie, además de estar ubicado muy lejos de su hogar; esto la llevó a agotarse y a cambiar de actividad, por eso alquiló un local donde se dedicó a la venta de almuerzos, donde aun se encuentra desde hace 2 años. Sus principales clientes son taxistas, albañiles, transeúntes, m tiene una empleada a la que paga diariamente, trabaja desde muy temprano hasta las 3:00 p.m. y vende de contado con una frecuencia diaria. Su infraestructura la conforman una estufa industrial, 6 juegos de mesas, una nevera y estantería metálica. En la actualidad está aplicando a un primer credikiva, primer financiamiento también que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen insumos como arroz, granos, azúcar, carnes para la elaboración de almuerzos. La razón de éxito de esta inversión es lograr comprar en mayor cantidad, lo cual disminuye los costos y la hace más competitiva en el mercado.
texts.en:
Ana is 62 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla where she sells lunches and homemade food from her restaurant. She is separated with three children and has been involved with commercial activities since she was very young. 

Before getting married, Ana worked in a municipality on the border of Colombia, where she worked for 22 years in a store and gained the majority of her business experience. With her current business she has been able to provide her children with an education and bring them ahead in life. She acquired two homes and thus addressed her biggest challenges before moving to Barranquilla.

In Barranquilla Ana has had various businesses, including selling stuffed arepas in a busy pedestrian area. She worked this business during night hours and in rough weather, and in addition it was located very far from her home so she wore herself out and decided to change activity. She rented a space where she began selling lunches, and she is still there two years later. 

Ana's main customers are taxi drivers, masons, and passersby. She has one employee whom she pays daily. Ana works from very early in the morning until 3 pm and sells every day for cash. Her business infrastructure is made up of an industrial stove, six sets of tables, a fridge, and metal shelving. 

Anna is applying for her first Kiva loan, which is also her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will purchase in bulk ingredients such as rice, grains, sugar, and meat for making lunches. This loan will be a success because through buying in bulk, Ana will be able to reduce her costs and thus be more competitive in the market.

loans.use: to purchase in bulk ingredients such as rice, grains, sugar, and meat.

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice mill business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and pay for her laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

Marry has been in this business for 12 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs and a lumberyard business.

Marry has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and pay for her laborers' salaries for her rice mill

loans.name: Bhuma

texts.en:
Bhuma is 26 years old. She is married and has 2 children aged 4 and 1. In 2002, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Bhuma plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is married with 2 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Macawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Candelaria is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers. 

Candelaria  has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. She hopes to have a brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 43 years old and married with 3 children. With all her children in school, Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Zenaida has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 45000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation business.

Anita has been in this business for 4 years. She earns additional income from clothing sales.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle .

loans.name: Jominda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Jominda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Jominda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks to sell for her business buying and selling rice.

Jominda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks to sell

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is married with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Meriam has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22500 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Meriam has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Victoria sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas”,  ella nació en la ciudad de Pisaq pero actualmente vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y tiene 5 hijos, 

La socia Victoria tiene un kiosco escolar donde vende todo tipo de golosinas como chizitos, galletas, dulces, chicles, chupetines entre otros más, ella ahora también se dedica a la venta de comida,  ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a sus hijos. 

La socia Victoria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, carne, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar entre otras cosas más. 

La socia Victoria está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria continues to participate as a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women). She was born in the city of Pisaq, but currently lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. Victoria has five children.

She has a school kiosk where she sells all types of snacks such as cheese puffs, cookies, candies, gum, lollipops, and other items. Now she also sells food. Victoria is a hardworking and enterprising woman who wants to move her children forward.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies such as vegetables, meat, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other items. Victoria is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees and other related expenses.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a married woman with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Cynthia has a frozen food business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy more frozen food to sell in her food stall.

Cynthia has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and married with 2 children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from electronic reloading.

Gina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Magda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Magda de los Angeles mujer entusiasta y apasionada al comercio pues manifiesta ser la mejor labor que el ser humano puede desempeñar ya que ella durante once años ha sido su propia jefa por el simple hecho de mantener hasta el dia de hoy lo que es la compra y venta de carne de cerdo. Su esposo quien esta por momento en el extranjero trabajando le ayuda con gastos del hogar y a cumplir con sus compromisos de pago en tiempo y forma. Con el proposito de seguir aumentando el inventario de su negocio acude una vez mas a la micro-financiera la cual en gran parte ha sido el medio para ella poder siempre tener producto que ofrecer a su clientela. Con el prestamo comprara cuatro cerdos en pie, misma inversion que la realiza para el bienestar de la familia y el engrandecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Magda de los Angeles is a woman who is enthusiastic and passionate about her trade. She says it is the best job a human could have. For the past 11 years, she has been her own boss. Magda has supported herself to this very day by buying and selling pork. Her husband is currently abroad working in order to help with the household expenses and so that they can pay their commitments in a timely manner.

In order to continue increasing the inventory of her business, Magda applied once again for a micro-loan. For the most part, this has been the means by which she is able to obtain product to offer to her customers. This loan will be used to buy four live pigs, which represents an investment in the welfare of her family and the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a married woman who has three children. She is 78 years old, and resides at Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Carmelita owns and operates a business planting & harvesting coconut on farmland and selling it to earn a living. She's been in this business 31 years. Each month, she earns 12,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to pay for coconut harvesting. In 2007, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Carmelita wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for coconut harvesting

loans.name: Gumersinda

texts.en:
Gumersinda is 62 years old and married with 9 children.

Gumersinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Gumersinda has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from an eatery.

Gumersinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Buelah

texts.en:
Buelah is 52 years old and married with three children.

Buelah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Buelah has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transportation.

Buelah aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy matooke to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and food vending.  Emma is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married with four children. She is 45 years old and lives in Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Mercy has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase feed and piglets. She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

Mercy hopes to have a brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel is 37 years old and married with five children.

Maridel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Maridel has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Maridel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is married with no children. She is 45 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Esterlita has a business buying and selling cosmetic products. She has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock for her cosmetic sales. Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

In the future, Esterlita hopes to have more savings someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her cosmetic sales

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married with four children. She is 54 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Cecilia has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,000. Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. She applied for PHP 14,900 to purchase sacks of feed and vaccines.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to expand her business into a piggery someday.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed and vaccines

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 40 years old and married with six children. Three of her children attend school.

Sharon has been in farming since a tender age, having lost her parents. No one cared to pay fees for her. So to make ends meet, she resorted to using her energies in the form of digging to earn a living. The man she later married was also a farmer.

She wants UGX 500,000 to buy shutters and plaster her incomplete residential house.. She will use the surplus to pay school fees for her children. 

Sharon's major challenges are the unpredictable climatic changes like heavy rains and severe sunshine, which affect the growth of her plants and their yields. Her own illnesses and those of her children also affect productivity on the days she is attending to the children or she is in poor health. She is also likely to spend money on the their illnesses, reducing her cash flow.

Sharon's dream is to construct a presentable residential house and educate her children to compensate for her lack of education. She describes herself as a very hard working and resilient woman. Sharon appears in the photo with her children in the house that she wants to complete.

loans.use: To complete her house and pay school fees.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio tiene 24 años, es un joven soltero que vive en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Perené, Chanchamayo. 
Desde pequeño aprendió las labores en la agricultura con sus padres, luego empezó a hacerlo independientemente. Poco a poco, fue ahorrando el dinero que ganaba y consiguió comprar una motocarro, con la ahora trabaja todos los días haciendo transporte de pasajeros dentro de su ciudad; esta labor le gusta y le es más gratificante. 
Como no es conformista, cuando ve oportunidades las aprovecha, es por ello que adicionalmente se desempeña como albañil en obras de construcción, y continúa haciéndose cargo de algunas parcelas de terrenos en las que siembra naranjas y plátanos.
Con el trabajo de transportista está ahorrando dinero que le permitirá incursionar en otros negocios, pues otra de sus metas es tener un puesto de comida, pero sólo los fines de semana, cuando hay más personas por las calles.

Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de ollas, platos y otros utensilios de cocina para empezar con su nuevo negocio de comidas.
texts.en:
Herminio, 24, is a young bachelor who lives in his own house in the district of Perené, Chanchamahyo.  He learned about agriculture from his parents as he was growing up, and then began working independently.  Little by little he was able to save the money he earned and bought a vehicle which he uses every day to transport passengers in the city.  He enjoys this work and finds it most gratifying.

Since he is not compliant, he takes advantage of the opportunities he sees; so he also works as a bricklayer at construction sites.  Meanwhile, he continues taking care of cropland and grows oranges and bananas.

Through his transport business he is able to save money that will allow him to go into other businesses.  One of his goals is to have a food stall on weekends, when the streets are busier with passersby.

This is his first loan through MFP and he is committed to paying it back on time.  He plans to use the money to buy pots and pans, dishes, and other kitchen utensils he needs to start the new food business.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Luisa Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, es madre de 2 hijos e 14 y 12 años de edad, a quienes saca adelante con mucho esfuerzo y sola ya que el padre de sus pequeños la abandono y desde allí se convirtió en madre y padre ellos y desde entonces no solo les da amor sino que cada día ella los mira y eso le da ánimos para continuar. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, también por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de tuna, algodón, maíz entre otros. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta jugar vóley con sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio, también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar gastronomía.

Con mucho esfuerzo luisa trabaja en su negocio de venta de comidas como polladas, salchipapas, pollo brosters, entre otros; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 6 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón para la preparación de los platillos.

Isabel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá compra mesas, sillas y una licuadora, de esta manera podrá brindarle mas comodidad a sus clientes y tendrá los implementos necesarios para realizar su trabajo, así ella podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Isabel is a hard-working, enthusiastic mother of two children, aged 14 and 12, who she is raising with much sacrifice on her own, since the children's father left her.  She has become both mother and father to them and provides them with loving care every day.  She lives in the city of Nazca, a city known for its warm climate and agriculture, especially for its prickly pear, cotton and corn crops, among others.  In her free time she enjoys playing volleyball with her friends and neighbors.  She also enjoys eating her favorite dish of chicken with rice.  She only has a high school education but would like to have studied gastronomy.

With much effort, Luisa works at her food business selling hot dogs and fries, broaster chicken and other dishes.  She spends about six hour and attends to up to 15 customers a day.  She believes the business is going so well because she is a good cook.

Isabel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks tho their support she will be able to buy tables, chairs and a blender.  This will enable her to provide better customer service and have the necessary work tools.  She wants to continue working toward her greatest goal which is: "To have her own house".

loans.use: To buy a blender, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Miluska

texts.es:
La socia Milusca sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco.  

La socia Milusca sigue dedicándose a brindar servicio de transportes en su carro, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien gracias a la puntualidad de sus pagos.    

La socia Milusca en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro ósea desea comprar llantas. 

La socia Milusca está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member, Miluska, continues in the communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" and she lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  

She continues providing transportation service with her vehicle.  She is a hard-working, enterprising lady who takes good care of her family.  The previous loan she had was successful as she made the payments on time.

On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy tires for her vehicle.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Lidy

texts.es:
La socia Lidy sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco.  

La socia Lidy sigue dedicándose a la venta de ropa y a la confección, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien gracias a la puntualidad de sus pagos.  

La socia Lidy en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser. 

La socia Lidy está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member, Lidy, continues in the communal bank "Mujeres Unidas", and she lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.

Lidy is still selling the clothing she makes.  She is a hard-working, enterprising lady who takes good care of her family.  Her previous loan was successful as she was punctual in her payments.

On this occasion, Lidy is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kpèdetin Christine

texts.fr: Kpèdetin Christine est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Benin. Kpèdetin Christine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Kpèdetin Christine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Cosme. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge et tous scolarisés. Kpèdetin Christine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Kpèdetin Christine mène comme activité la vente de divers articles et de la farine de blé. De façon secondaire, Kpèdetin Christine produit de l'huile de palme (à base des noix de palme) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Kpèdetin Christine mène cette activité depuis une douzaine d'année. Kpèdetin Christine s’approvisionne dans une région du Benin. Dans la quête de la meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’améliorer son activité, Kpèdetin Christine sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Kpèdetin Christine is 34 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. Kpèdetin Christine is married to a farmer named Cosme.The couple have five dependent children who all go to school. Kpèdetin Christine lives with her husband and her children. The couple share the various household expenses. Kpèdetin Christine has a business selling various articles including wheat flour.On a secondary basis Kpèdetin Christine produces palm oil (from a palm nut base) that she sells from home. She has been running this business for about twelve years. Kpèdetin Christine buys her stock in a region of Benin. In order to give more satisfaction to her customers and improve her business, Kpèdetin Christine requests a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts for the production of palm nut oil.

loans.name: Crispin Javier

texts.es:
Crispin es un joven de 25 años el cual vive al lado de su esposa y de sus 4 pequeños hijos cuyas edades comprenden 12, 9,6 y 4 añitos, Crispin ama muchísimo a sus hijos y sobre todo trabaja con mucho esmero para darles una buena calidad de vida y también para que se sientan orgullosos de el. Su vivienda se encuentra en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, también por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de tuna, algodón, maíz entre otros. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre el gusta escuchar música y también aprovecha la ocasión para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Locro”; el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Civil.

Día a día Crispin trabaja en su negocio como maestro constructor, el le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 8 horas al día, pero cuando es una construcción un poco más grande el trabaja mas horas; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsables y sobre todo porque realiza su trabajo con  muchas ganas. 

Crispin está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar maquinaria para hacer concreto, de esta manera podrá tener las herramientas necesarias para realizar bien su trabajo, así el podrá seguir luchando dia a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder tener un terreno para construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Crispin, 25, is a young man who lives with his wife and four small children, ages 12, 9, 6 and 4.  Crispin loves his famly and works hard to give them a quality lifetyle so they will be proud of him.  His house is in the city of Nazca, which is known for its warm climate and agriculture, especially its prickly pear, cotton and corn crops, among others.  In his free time he enjoys listening to music and eating his favorite dishes, such as the delicious "Locro" (corn and potato stew).  He only has a high school education but would like to have studied Civil Engineering.

Every day Crispin works at his business as a master builder.  He usually works around eight hours a day, unless the construction project is larger, requiring more hours.  He believes business is going well because he is very responsible and works hard.

Crispin is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since their help will allow him to buy machinery to make concrete.  This will give him the necessary tools for his work, so he can continue striving toward his greatest goal: "To buy land and build a house".

loans.use: To buy machinery to make concrete.

loans.name: Eugenia Isabel

texts.es: Eugenia  de 33 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y su hija de 13 años de edad. Allí tiene un negocio a través del cual se dedica a la elaboración de almuerzos, productos pasabocas y dulces. Su negocio lo inició hace 4 años, cuando con una amiga vendían estos productos para varias empresas, pero un día su amiga se fue a vivir a otro país y la obligación de dar respuesta a su clientela se le convirtió en un gran desafío; ella decidió dedicarse a una sola empresa y con ello a vender otros productos para eventos, acompañada de su hija. Con su negocio le ha ido bien y hace ahorros,  con los que hace adecuaciones a su vivienda y compra lo que necesita. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará un molino, una picadora, reparar su nevera y comprará productos desechables. Su inversión será exitosa porque mejorará sus condiciones de trabajo  y en este ambiente será mucho mas productiva e impactará a su clientela, que es finalmente quien le proporciona las ganancias.
texts.en: Eugenia is 33 years old. She lives in the town of Soledad with her spouse and her 13 year old daughter. She has a business there with which she makes lunches, snacks and sweets. She started her business 4 years ago, when she sold these products to various businesses with a friend. One day her friend went to live in another country, and the obligation to respind to her clientele became a big challenge. She decided to dedicate herself to one business and sell products for events with her daughter. It has gone well for her with her business and she is able to save money with which she has fixed up her home and buy what she needs. At present she is applying for a new Kiva loan, the first loan she has made with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a grinder, a dicer, repair her refrigerator and buy disposable products. Her investment will be succesful because it will improve her working conditions and in this enviroment she will be much more productive and that will impact her clientele, which is what will bring her earnings in the end.

loans.use: to buy a grinder, a dicer, repair has refrigerator and buy disposable products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material to remodel the facade of her house.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun is aged 52 years old and married. She has five children and lives with her family in the rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. Four  children are still dependent on her. Rice farming is one of the main sources of her family's income and she has been in this business for 21 years. She also plants cassava and rubber trees to gain extra income and sometimes she works for others, plowing land for pay. 

This is Sokun's second loan from VisionFund. The first loan has enabled her to support and feed her family sufficiently. With her current business, she manages to earn a daily income of around 82,000 KHR. After having completely paid back the loan, she is now requesting another loan from VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and a plowshare to prepare her land for farming. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a plowshare for land preparation for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 6 children aged between 12 and 24 years. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Teresita started her sari-sari (general) store business a year ago. She sells items like vinegar, soy sauce, snack foods and toiletries. She earns 400 PHP per day. Teresita works hard to increase her daily income and to be able to support her children's education. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks and rice. This will help increase Teresita's sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks and rice

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 36 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. She is married with two children.
 
To earn a living, Salome has a business buying and selling hypo (calcium hypochlorite, a disinfectant). She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Salome has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase gallons of hypo for sale.

Salome has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Salome hopes to have enough savings for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of hypo for sale

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Ponheak Krek district, Sokha is aged 57 years old and married with seven children. Five of them are still dependent on her.  Her children work at the family's business and a few of them are still in school. Her family's main income is from rice and cassava farming.  She has been in this business for 33 years. She manages to make an income of around 53,000 KHR per day from her current business to support her big family and she  is able to save around 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is Sokha's first loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. With the need to support her business, she is applying for a loan with VisionFund of 4,000,000 KHR. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion to meet her family's needs. She hopes to improve her crop yields and sell the crops for a good price so as to build on some savings for the future and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Prancrecia

texts.en:
Prancrecia is married with six children. Prancrecia is 52 years old and lives in Tori, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Prancrecia has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2 ,500. 

Prancrecia has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Prancrecia hopes to have a brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for pigs.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 38 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel. She is married with five children.
 
To earn a living Elsie has a business of snacks vending. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. Elsie has a requested loan of PHP 20000 to purchase for flour, sugar and cooking oil.

Elsie has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Elsie hopes to expand her business and have enough saving for her family.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a selling dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Gina is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Haydde

texts.es: La socia Haydde sigue con su negocio de compra y venta de verduras y productos remojados, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para invertir el crédito en la compra de productos para remojar como por ejemplo moraya, tarwi, trigo, habas entre otros productos, ella desea implementar su negocio y seguir prosperando y brindando mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Haydde continues with her business of buying and selling vegetables and products that have been soaked.  At this opportunity, she needs a loan to invest into the purchase of products to soak such as dehydrated potatoes, tarwi (an Andean lupine with an edible bean), wheat, and beans, among other items.  She wants to expand her business and continue to prosper and provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy products to soak such as, for example, dehydrated potatoes, tarwi, wheat and beans, among other items.

loans.name: Daysi María

texts.es: Doña Daysi es una clienta con bastante trayectoria en la Fundación. Se dedica a varias actividades que la han hecho crecer en su negocio y superarse personalmente. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en los diferentes negocios. Siempre nos ha demostrado su responsabilidad y puntualidad a la hora de sus pagos. Ahora solicita un représtamo para acondicionar un local con el equipo necesario y brindar los servicios de recaudación de servicios públicos. En sus créditos anteriores le ha ido muy bien y por eso la idea de seguir creciendo para generar ingresos y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Daysi is a client with a great deal of history in the Fundación.  She dedicates herself to various activities that have made her grow in her business and supersede personally.  She counts with the support of her children in the different businesses.  She has always shown us her responsible and timely nature at the time her loan payments were due.  

Currently, she requests a loan to outfit a locale with the necessary equipment to provide public services collections.  Things have gone very well for her with her previous loans, which is why she got the idea to continue growing to generate more income and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy equipment and raw material.

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFA est formé de cinq personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Fifamè est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Fifamè est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un dépanneur du nom de Simon. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Fifamè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a quinze ans, Fifamè vend des condiments et de l’huile de palme dans un marché du Benin. Ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Fifamè achète ses produits dans deux différentes localités du Benin. Dans le but d’être de plus en plus compétitive et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Fifamè désire obtenir un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFA. les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Fifa group is made up of 5 friends who all live in the same village. Fifamè, the group's representative, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. This is the 3rd time that the group requests financial support from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their business.

Fifamè is 36 years old and is married to a breakdown mechanic called Simon. The couple have 5 dependent children, some of whom go to school. The couple live together with their children and they both take care of the household responsibilities. Fifamè did not go to school. She has been selling condiments and palm oil at a market in Benin for 15 years. This enables her to meet her children's needs. Fifamè gets her products from two different villages in Benin.

With the aim of becoming more competitive and better responding to customer demand, Fifamè would like to get a 3rd loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of Fifa. The 2 previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments and palm oil.

loans.name: Rosa Emperatriz

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven de 30 años la cual vive al lado de su pequeño hijo de 7 años de edad, Rosa lo quiere muchísimo es su razón de vivir y su motor para salir cada día con entusiasmo y con muchas ganas de trabajar. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, algodón, paprika, entre otros. Cuando Rosa tiene un tiempo libre le gusta jugar vóley con sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio, también en oportunidades le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche y el Arroz con pato”.

Con mucho entusiasmo Rosa trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 4 horas al día ya que también trabaja haciendo limpieza en casas, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es  muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo trabajadora.

Rosa esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio, en especial ropa de invierno como chompas, pantalones, buzos, casacas, entre otros, de esta manera tendrá mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una tienda de lencería y bijouteria”.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 30-year old young woman that lives with her small son, who is 7 years old.  Rosa loves him very much; he is her reason for living, and what drives her to go out each day with enthusiasm and a great desire to work.  Her home is located in the city of Ica, which is characterized for having a warm climate year-round.  It is an agricultural area that produces, primarily, grapes, cotton, and paprika, among other crops.  When Rosa has free time, she likes to play volleyball with her friends and neighbors.  Also, at times, she likes to eat one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Ceviche with Rice and Duck”.

Rosa works in her business selling clothing with great enthusiasm.  She dedicates herself to working around 4 hours per day, since she also cleans houses.  She believes that things are going well in her business because she is very kind to her customers and, most of all, is a hard worker.

Rosa is very thankful for the Kiva loans given that, thanks to the help they have provided, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her enterprise.  In particular, she can purchase winter clothing such as sweaters, pants, tracksuits, and jackets, among other items.  In this way, she’ll have a greater variety of products to offer to customers and improve her income to continue working towards making her biggest dream a reality:  “To have a lingerie and costume jewelry store.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (sweaters, jackets, tracksuits, and pants, among other items).

loans.name: Ines Paulina

texts.es: La socia Ines nació en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 27 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella tiene una cabina de internet en su domicilio y también tiene un pequeño local alquilado donde vende comida, el local funciona por las mañanas como restaurante y por las tardes como pollería, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, papas, verduras, carne, fideos y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Ines was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 27 years old, and in a common law marriage from which she has two children.  She has an Internet booth in her home, and also has a small rented locale where she sells food.  The site serves as a restaurant in the mornings, and as a poultry store in the afternoons.  At this opportunity, she requires a loan to buy supplies such as, for example, sacks of rice, potatoes, vegetables, meat, noodles, and other items.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as, for example, sacks of rice, potatoes, vegetables, meat, noodles, and other items.

loans.name: Kpemahuton 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KPEMAHUTON 2 est composé de trois personnes qui s'approvisionnent au même endroit. La représentante du groupe du nom de Yénoukoumè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Yénoukoumè est âgée de 54 ans et vit au Bénin. Yénoukoumè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Yénoukoumè est mariée à un certain Assoclé. Le couple a cinq enfants dont trois enfants sont à leur charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Yénoukoumè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Yénoukoumè vend de gasoil et de l’huile à moteur à son domicile depuis vingt cinq ans. Yénoukoumè s’approvisionne au Nigeria. Grâce aux revenus que lui génèrent ces activités, Yénoukoumè contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Yénoukoumè sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KPEMAHUTON 2. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Kpemahuton 2 group is composed of 3 people who all get their supplies in the same area. The group's representative, Yénoukoumè, is the one with her hand raised in the picture.

Yénoukoumè is 54 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. Yénoukoumè is married to Associé. The couple have 5 children, 3 of whom are still in their charge. All the children have been to school. Yénoukoumè lives together with her husband and children, and she and her husband share the various household responsibilities.

In order to be able to respond to the various household needs, Yénoukoumè has been selling diesel and engine oil from her home for 25 years. She gets her supplies in Nigeria. Thanks to the income generated by her business, Yénoukoumè can contribute to the various household expenditures.

With a view to satisfying the needs of her growing clientele, Yénoukoumè is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of Kpemahuton 2. The loans previously received have all been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy cans of diesel oil and engine oil.

loans.name: François Sètondji

texts.fr: François Sètondji est âgé de 38 ans et vit au Benin. François Sètondji a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire et a appris le métier de plomberie. François Sètondji est marié à un certain Gisèle. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge dont trois constituent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. François Sètondji vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, François Sètondji exerce l'activité de plomberie et vend également des produits de plomberie de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. François Sètondji s’approvisionne en produits de plomberie au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’améliorer son  activité, François Sètondji sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
François Sètondji is 38 years old and lives in Benin. He left school at the secondary level and learned how to be a plumber. François Sètondji is married to Gisèle. The couple have 4 dependent children, 3 of whom are their own. All the children are attending school. François Sètondji lives together with his wife and children, and the couple share the household responsibilities.

François Sètondji has been a plumber for 15 years and also sells plumbing products as a sideline business; this enables him to better meet his family's needs. He gets his plumbing products in Nigeria.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and with the view to improving his business, François Sètondji is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy plumbing products.

loans.name: Amparo Cecilia

texts.es: Amparo  de 51 años de edad vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a la orilla del mar caribe, ella tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 22 y 24 años y se dedica a la fabricación de calzado femenino, un su pequeña casa donde tiene su taller. En su negocio produce alzado para damas, caballeros e infantil, actividad que aprendió en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje SENA, hace 2 años. Antes de haber iniciado su  pequeña fabrica de calzado, se dedicaba a la venta de mercancías  como ropa y calzado, además de perfumería y accesorios. Su necesidad la ha impulsado a buscar oportunidades de negocios y con ello ha desarrollado muchas de sus habilidades como negociante. Recientemente su hijo mayor la apoyó para que comprara una máquina  de hacer crispetas, y ella la ubica en plaza del pueblo todos los fines de semana, generándole resultados excelentes, por lo cual está planeando comprar otra. En la actualidad está planeando hacer un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará materias primas e insumos,  para elaborar maíz para elaborar crispetas y calzado en un mayor volumen  y vende cada vez más. Con su anterior financiamiento con la Fundación,  logró aumentar considerablemente la producción y ventas de calzado. Su meta mas adelante, es contratar operarios, para aumentar su producción y comprar una maquina para elaborar crispetas, dos negocios con los cuales planea ganar mucho mas dinero y lograr aumentar su bienestar y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Amparo is 51 years old and lives in the Puerto Colombia municipality, situated on the shore of the Caribbean Ocean.  She has 3 children from 22 to 24 years of age, and dedicates herself to making women’s shoes from a workshop located in her small house.  In her enterprise, she makes shoes for women, men and children, an activity she learned at the National Training Service SENA two years ago.

Prior to starting her small shoe workshop, she dedicated herself to selling merchandise such as perfumes and accessories.  Her needs motivated her to look for business opportunities and, through these, she has developed many of her skills as a negotiator.  Recently, her eldest son supported her in the purchase of a popcorn machine.  She positions it in the town’s plaza every weekend, which has generated excellent results for her and therefore she is thinking about buying another one.

Currently, she is planning a Kiva loan that would be her second financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the funds to buy raw materials and supplies to make popcorn and shoes in greater volume so she can increase her sales.  With her previous loan with the Fundación, she managed to augment her production and shoe sales considerably.  Looking ahead, her goals are to hire employees to increase production and to buy a popcorn machine.  With these two businesses, she plans to earn much more money and succeed in obtaining her own, as well has her family’s, well being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies for making popcorn and shoes in greater quantities.

loans.name: Finagnon Rolande

texts.fr: Finagnon Rolande est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Benin. Finagnon Rolande a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire et a appris le métier de photographie. Finagnon Rolande est mariée à un certain Jean-Eudes. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge dont trois constituent leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Finagnon Rolande vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a quatorze ans environs, Finagnon Rolande exerce l'activité de photographie et vend également des ustensiles de cuisine de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Finagnon Rolande s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’améliorer son activité, Finagnon Rolande sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Finagnon Rolande is 37 years old and she lives in Benin. She attended secondary school and learned photography. She is married to a man named Jean-Eudes, and the couple have five dependent children, three of them being their own. Some of the children go to school. Finagnon Rolande lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Finagnon Rolande started working as a photographer about 14 years ago. As a sideline, she sells kitchen utensils, which helps her to better meet the needs of her family. She buys her merchandise in a city of Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and bolster her business, Finagnon Rolande is seeking a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy a photo printer and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Yira Mercedes

texts.es: Yira de 32 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene una hija de 11 años, con quien sueña ver convertida en una mujer exitosa  y es ella el motor de su vida y la de su esposo. Yira tiene su propio negocio, mediante el cual vende mercancía variada, como cubrelechos, ropa para damas, artículos deportivos etc. Yira terminó sus estudios de bachiller muy temprano, a sus 16 años e inició una carrera técnica como auxiliar bancaria y con este conocimiento logró trabajar como empleada de una empresa privada. Posteriormente desde hace dos años, con el fin de apoyar la gestión de su esposo en el comercio, actividad a la que este se dedica, inició también su propia aventura de negocios, vendiendo muchos artículos al detalle, en un clientela que poco a poco a ha venido captando. En la actualidad su meta de crecimiento no se detiene, así como el aumento de su clientela, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder al sueño de ampliar su cobertura de clientes; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cubrelechos, calzado, artículos decorativos para el hogar, accesorios femeninos, entre otros artículos que encuentra mas económicos, en una ciudad fronteriza de Colombia en la cual compra.
